page.title: 12Surface Water:Chilterns.
page.content: There is a series of{ponds}around {Penn;}some form a north to south line between{Penn}and the{Wye Valley.}These {ponds}were probably formed at the end of the{Ice Age}on the clay soils left covering the{Chiltern chalk.}Some like {Penn Pond}have been built up and preserved by Man. There is quite a variety of{wild life in the{ponds}and{streams}in our area. The Moorhens and Mallards were the only birds. The amphibians that we found are Newts, Frogs, Toads and spawn was found. The other animals were Bull Heads, Water Snails, Water Beetles and Leeches.{Plant life}in the {pond}is mostly Reeds and Rushes. The water in the{Back Stream, River {Wye}and{Lagoon}is quite clear and not seriously polluted. The pollution that is in the river is man-made rubbish.
